summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell on the S2 Superseding Indictment. It details logistical arrangements for the public and victims to attend or listen to the proceeding, including COVID-19 protocols and teleconference access.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, scheduled for arraignment on the S2 Superseding Indictment.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, issuing the order regarding the arraignment logistics.

events.title: Arraignment on S2 Superseding Indictment
events.description: Scheduled arraignment proceeding for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in Courtroom 24B.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, NY
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment on a superseding indictment (S2) is scheduled for April 23, 2021.
The court order establishes specific COVID-19 protocols for public attendance, including mask requirements and temperature checks.
The court will provide public access via an overflow room video feed and a public teleconference line for audio.
The government and defense counsel must inform the court by April 21, 2021, if any alleged victims or defendant's family members wish to attend.
The order cites the Crime Victims' Rights Act (18 U.S.C. ยง 3771) regarding victim notification and access to proceedings.
